Christianity is a “monotheistic religion based on the life and teachings of Jesus of Nazareth as presented in the New Testament…. Christians believe Jesus is the Son of God, God having become human and the savior of humanity…. Christianity has around 2.2 billion adherents… and is the world’s largest religion.” [Source: Wikipedia]

This topic page will focus on religious conversations, ministry and events within Christendom, along with global affairs having implications on Christians worldwide.

Resources on Christianity:

  • Christianity: An Introduction
  • Christianity: The First Three Thousand Years
  • Mere Christianity
  • What’s So Great About Christianity
  • The Vatican
  • Christianity Today

Immigration is a hot-button issue in the U.S. right now. Between the Arizona law, violence in Mexico, and cash-strapped law enforcement agencies, there are new, urgent stories every day.

\n

Help find some of the best (and worst) coverage of this topic. Please review or post stories below.

From March 29th to April 4th, 2010, NewsTrust teamed up with with the Huffington Post’s NYC portal and its Eyes and Ears team, as well as City Limits, to review news and opinions on local economic issues ranging from unemployment to government cutbacks in New York City.

\n

Read our News Hunt Results on the NewsTrust Blog.

In June 2010, during the peak of the BP oil crisis, we hosted an Energy News Hunt with The Long Now Foundation, to find good journalism about the future of energy — with a focus on low carbon solutions that can scale quickly power the whole planet. In the process, we reviewed over 250 news stories. Read our findings on our blog.

Religion and Politics focuses on the influences and relationships between political officials and governments with religion and faith communities.

This topic page will consider current events that bear implications on religion and politics, including how religious conversation and exercise affects politics, and how political dialogue and action impacts communities of faith.

Resources on Religion and Politics:

  • Real Clear Religion
  • The Pew Forum on Religion and Public Life
  • Council on Foreign Relations: Religion and Foreign Policy
  • Politics and Religion Journal
  • Religion and Politics in the United States
  • An Introduction to International Relations and Religion
  • Religion and Politics in the International System Today
  • Sacred Causes: The Clash of Religion and Politics, from the Great War to the War on Terror

Around the world, activists and social entrepreneurs are changing the lives of millions with innovative solutions to issues like poverty, disease and persecution. We’re looking for good journalism that highlights their accomplishments — and suggests simple steps that each of us can take to help change the world. Please review our recommended news and opinion on this topic below.
